abstract: Retired New York City Police Officer Frank Serpico, who became well-known after blowing whistle on police corruption in 1970s, is running as Democrat for seat on all-Republican town board in Stuyvesant, NY; hopes to draw attention to corruption and cronyism he claims pervades politics in area.
lead_paragraph: Frank Serpico, whose whistle-blowing in the New York Police Department made him a household name, is running for office in Stuyvesant, N.Y.

headline.main: Serpico, Seeking Seat on Town Board, Sees Corruption and Pledges to Fight It
headline.print_headline: Serpico, Seeking Town Board Seat, Says He Sees Corruption and Vows to Fight It

snippet: Frank Serpico, whose whistle-blowing in the New York Police Department made him a household name, is running for office in Stuyvesant, N.Y.
